i3pubtools.sources module¶

i3pubtools.sources.dec(sign, deg, mins, secs)¶

Converts declination to radians.

More function info…

Parameters

  • sign (int) – A positive integer for a positive sign, a negative integer for a negative sign.

  • deg (float) – Degrees.

  • mins (float) – Minutes.

  • secs (float) – Seconds.

Return type

float

Returns

Radian representation of declination.

i3pubtools.tools.rotate(ra1, dec1, ra2, dec2, ra3, dec3)¶

Rotation matrix for rotation of (ra1, dec1) onto (ra2, dec2).

The rotation is performed on (ra3, dec3).

i3pubtools.time_profiles module¶

class i3pubtools.time_profiles.GaussProfile(mean, sigma, name='gauss_tp')¶

Bases: i3pubtools.time_profiles.GenericProfile

Time profile class for a gaussian distribution.

Use this to produce gaussian-distributed times for your source.

float

class i3pubtools.time_profiles.GenericProfile¶

Bases: object

A generic base class to standardize the methods for the time profiles.

While I’m only currently using scipy-based probability distributions, you can write your own if you want. Just be sure to define these methods and ensure that the PDF is normalized!

default_params¶

A dictionary of fitting parameters for this time profile.

Type

Dict

param_dtype¶

The numpy dytpe for the fitting parameters.

Type

List[Tuple[str, str]]

class i3pubtools.time_profiles.UniformProfile(start, end, name='uniform_tp')¶

Bases: i3pubtools.time_profiles.GenericProfile

Time profile class for a uniform distribution.

Use this for background or if you want to assume a steady signal from your source.
